intro: Eriogonum beatleyae, commonly known as Beatley's buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Eriogonum beatleyae is often found in open woodlands and is an important component of local ecosystems.
